content: In Greek mythology, what was the name of the king who was cursed to eternally roll a boulder up a hill only for it to roll back down when it nears the top?

Ah, you're referring to one of the classic tales from Greek mythology. The king you're thinking of is Sisyphus. He was known for his cunning and deceitfulness, and as a punishment for his actions, he was condemned to an eternity of frustration in the underworld. Specifically, he had to roll a massive boulder up a hill, only to have it roll back down just as it reached the top, forcing him to start over again, ad infinitum. It's a powerful symbol of meaningless labor and never-ending tasks.
